intro: Randia rotundifolia, commonly known as round-leaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to round leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Randia rotundifolia is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, sunny conditions.
